translation.en: My restaurant's quite small.
And I still cook outside.
No one comes to Jay Fai's place for the ambiance.
translation.ko: 하지만 분위기를 찾아 쩨파이에 오는 사람은 없어요

translation.en: They come because the food is delicious.
Even as a kid
I woke up thinking about work.
I'd do it every day if I could.
translation.ko: 할 수 있는 한 매일 일하고 싶어요

translation.en: Every day, I wake up at 10:30 in the morning.
My staff arrives around noon to help.
translation.ko: 직원 하나가 정오쯤 출근해서 일손을 거들어 주고요

translation.en: I'm old, but I always tell them,
translation.ko: 저는 늙었지만 직원들한테 늘 하는 말이 있어요

translation.en: "You may be younger, but I am stronger."
By 2:30 in the afternoon, I'm ready.
When I walk into my station,
I have to be focused.
I am meticulous about every dish that I serve.
translation.ko: 모든 음식 하나하나를 세심하게 요리해서 내보내요

translation.en: Everything must be flawless.
No matter what's going on. No matter how tired I am.
I cook every dish myself.
translation.ko: 이곳의 모든 요리를 제가 직접 만들어요

translation.en: I want it to be the best.
Because I'm not just a street cook.
translation.ko: 저는 단순한 길 위의 셰프가 아니에요

translation.en: I'm a chef.
My older brother opened our noodle stall
on Sukhumvit 38 road.
Back then, over 30 years ago,
translation.ko: 가게를 시작했을 때가 30년 정도 전이었는데 "쿤수메 수쿰윗 38번가 유명한 바미 주인"

translation.en: the place was surrounded by bars.
After the party-goers finished, they would come to eat.
translation.ko: 밤늦게까지 논 사람들이 우리 가게에 와서 배를 채웠죠

translation.en: We would sell until 4 or 5 in the morning.
Last year, the landlord suddenly shut us down.
translation.ko: 그런데 작년에 갑자기 땅 주인이 우리를 쫓아냈어요

translation.en: Most of our fellow vendors quit and moved back to their hometowns.
translation.ko: 노점상 대부분이 장사를 접고 고향으로 돌아갔지만

translation.en: But our customers kept calling.
"Hello? Hello? Where are you? Will you start selling again?"
translation.ko: 어디에 있냐면서 다시 장사 안 하냐고 묻더군요

translation.en: My brother suggested re-opening near my house.
translation.ko: 형님은 편하게 집 근처에 다시 가게를 열자고 했어요

translation.en: Our customers missed us so much they took taxis out to see us.
translation.ko: 우리를 그리워한 손님들이 택시를 타고 찾아왔죠

translation.en: The noodles cost 60 baht, the taxi costs over 300 baht.
They were so happy to come out here and eat.
We were so happy to see them.
I grew up in a slum.
In a bad neighborhood behind a market.
Mom sold rice porridge and noodles at the market.
translation.ko: 어머니는 시장에 나가서 쌀죽과 닭고기국수를 파셨어요

translation.en: She had to sell it a lot.
Dad was an opium addict.
Sometimes he ran away. We didn't know where he was.
So I became a seamstress.
I sewed dresses all day and cut fabric all night.
translation.ko: 낮에는 원단을 자르고 말기도 하고 밤에는 드레스를 봉제했어요

translation.en: I made sure there was rice to eat.
translation.ko: 집에 먹을 게 떨어지지 않게 하려고 했죠

translation.en: I spent ten years as a seamstress.
Time flew by when I did this sort of work.
translation.ko: 그 일을 할 땐 시간이 쏜살같이 흘렀어요

translation.en: I was content.
But then one day, I was sewing...
translation.ko: 그러던 어느 날 한창 재단하고 봉제하던 와중

translation.en: Boom! A stairway collapsed.
translation.ko: 폭발음이 나더니 제 근처에 있던 계단이 무너졌어요

translation.en: Fire erupted.
Everyone shouted, "Run!"
I ran outside, looked back and everything was gone.
translation.ko: 밖으로 뛰어나와 돌아보니 모든 게 사라져 버렸어요

translation.en: I had nothing left.
After everything burned down, all I had were the pajamas on my back.
translation.ko: 죄다 불타 없어지고 남은 건 입고 있던 잠옷뿐이었어요

translation.en: My sewing machine was gone, all my tools were gone.
translation.ko: 재봉틀뿐만 아니라 도구란 도구는 전부 사라져 버렸죠

translation.en: I was twenty-five years old.
I didn't know what to do.
One day, I was watching my mom sell noodles across from the market.
translation.ko: 그 후 저희 어머니가 국수 장사 하시는 걸 지켜봤어요

translation.en: I noticed how slowly she cooked.
translation.ko: 어느 날 장사를 돕다가 어머니가 느리다는 걸 깨달았죠

translation.en: Four to five customers were just standing there, waiting for their food.
translation.ko: 손님 너덧 명이 우두커니 음식을 기다리고 있었거든요

translation.en: I was frustrated.
I told her I wanted to cook.
She told me I couldn't do it.
"Okay, you don't think I can do this?"
That night I grabbed the wok,
I started stir-frying noodles.
I practiced by myself every night. Ate that food every night.
translation.ko: 매일 밤 연습하고 제 음식을 먹어 봤죠

translation.en: At one point I poured oil into a wok and forgot about it.
translation.ko: 한번은 웍에 기름을 부어 놓고 까맣게 잊어버린 거예요

translation.en: When I saw the oil burning, I dumped it all out.
I got so mad, I threw noodles into the pan,
translation.ko: 너무 화가 나서 그 웍에 면을 던져 넣고

translation.en: and stirred them furiously.
The heat alone browned them nicely.
I didn't need any oil.
They had a wonderful taste and aroma.
The next day,
I asked Mom for her wok.
She let me have it. It was all up to me.
When I started to cook, the customers saw I had talent.
translation.ko: 제가 요리하기 시작하자 손님들이 제 재능을 알아봤어요

translation.en: Right then, I began to see my path.
translation.ko: 바로 그때를 기점으로 제가 나아갈 길이 보이기 시작했죠

translation.en: -Are these my rice noodles? -Yes.
Weigh them again.
I need one kilo, this is nearly two.
These mushrooms are too small.
I need two pieces, not three.
translation.ko: 세 조각 말고 두 조각으로 썰어

translation.en: I love every dish that I cook.
You have to love them to cook them properly, down to every little detail.
translation.ko: 자기 요리를 사랑해야 세세한 부분까지 챙길 수 있어요

translation.en: Especially, tom yum.
The stock soup must be rich and tasty, that's very important.
You start with lots of bones to make the broth.
And you just keep adding bones,
bird's eye chilies, fish sauce, and lime juice.
Do you know how delicious it is?
What about stir-fried noodles or tom yum?
Street cooks don't make much money.
translation.ko: 길거리 음식 장사는 그리 안 복잡해요

translation.en: They're just out there cooking late into the night.
Just like me when I didn't have a permanent shophouse.
translation.ko: 고정된 가게를 차리기 전엔 저도 그렇게 일했어요

translation.en: By the time I was 30, I was responsible for my whole family.
translation.ko: 저는 30대가 됐을 때 집안을 책임져야 했어요

translation.en: I was right on the street.
Chicken noodles, that's all I sold.
Sometimes I cooked until 4:00 or 5:00 a.m.
translation.ko: 새벽 4-5시까지 요리하고 동틀 무렵에 자는 날도 있었죠

translation.en: Life was very hard.
I had to put all my tables out on the sidewalk.
Sometimes, the authorities would chase us off.
On nights when it rained
or when they didn't let us put out tables,
translation.ko: 당국에서 나와서 장사를 못 하게 하면

translation.en: we were doomed.
I was trying hard to make money, but I was struggling.
translation.ko: 돈을 벌려고 안간힘을 썼지만 막다른 길에 직면했어요

translation.en: I had to do something.
translation.ko: 다른 시도를 해야 한다는 걸 깨달았죠

translation.en: So, I took a risk.
I borrowed some money.
And I bought some prawns.
Tiger prawns, very fresh.
I set the price at 120 baht.
One guy balked, said it was only a shrimp pad thai.
translation.ko: 한 손님이 그래 봤자 팟타이 아니냐길래

translation.en: I told him these prawns were totally different.
Don't compare them to anyone else's.
He ate them once and never ordered chicken again.
translation.ko: 그 손님은 그걸 맛본 뒤로 닭고기국수는 시키지도 않아요

translation.en: I knew the dish was a success.
I started to look to expensive things, like seafood.
translation.ko: 저는 해산물 같은 값비싼 재료를 찾기 시작했어요

translation.en: Higher quality ingredients meant higher prices.
That's how I got the money to rent my shophouse.
translation.ko: 그렇게 해서 가게 임대 자금을 번 거예요

translation.en: No matter where we go,
the journey begins with curry.
Jek Pui was my father.
He studied how to make curry before he left China.
translation.ko: 중국에서 이곳으로 오셨을 때 카레 조리법을 배우셨어요

translation.en: When my father could cook curry,
his family sent him to Thailand to make a new life.
translation.ko: 친척들은 가족도 데려와서 새 삶을 시작하라고 했죠 "쩨치아 쩩뿌이 2세대 주인"

translation.en: We've been here for over 70 years.
He worked hard developing his recipe.
Sometimes he got it right, sometimes wrong, but he kept at it.
At 13, I started helping him out.
translation.ko: 저는 열세 살에 아버지를 돕기 시작했어요

translation.en: My father only sold pork and beef curries.
translation.ko: 아버지는 돼지고기와 쇠고기 딱 두 종류 카레만 파셨죠

translation.en: I created our other dishes myself.
We've added green curry with meatballs or chicken
and pork Penang.
When customers loved them, that meant the recipes were right.
translation.ko: 손님들이 맛있어하면 그 요리법이 옳은 거였죠

translation.en: Back when I moved into my restaurant,
I still called myself a street cook.
translation.ko: 전 저를 길 위의 셰프라고 불렀죠

translation.en: I opened my shop in the evenings.
My customers came from bars and gambling joints.
The ones who really loved to eat
would gather around to watch me cook.
I saw an opportunity.
Anyone could stir-fry pad thai.
translation.ko: 하지만 팟타이는 누구나 만들 수 있는 음식이었죠

translation.en: I wanted to do something great.
I loved crab omelettes.
But I wanted to make something different.
translation.ko: 그 요리를 응용해서 새로운 형태로 만들고 싶었어요

translation.en: So I taught myself to make Japanese omelettes.
I added a lot of crabs, nearly a pound.
I flattened and rolled them.
translation.ko: 그 후 납작하게 누른 뒤 돌돌 말았죠

translation.en: When I took my first bite, oh ho!
translation.ko: 처음 한 입을 먹어 보고는 깜짝 놀랐어요

translation.en: It was so beautiful, I'd done it.
translation.ko: 그런 아름다운 맛을 냈다는 게 감격스러웠죠

translation.en: I had something special to sell.
translation.ko: 비로소 특별한 요리를 팔 수 있게 된 거예요

translation.en: People started to talk about my food.
translation.ko: 제 음식이 점차 회자됐고 사람들이 왔어요

translation.en: The gambling houses started calling in lots of orders.
translation.ko: 도박장에서는 전화로 수십 그릇씩 주문하기 시작했죠

translation.en: We started selling so many crab omelettes,
sometimes we ran out of eggs.
Is Khun Da here?
Please come in.
From that point on, I started to build a whole new menu.
translation.ko: 그때부터 완전히 새로운 메뉴를 구성하기 시작했어요

translation.en: New dishes just came to me.
Famous high ranked people and politicians started to turn up.
They would ask for special things.
I had so many dishes to recommend.
I was proud of my bravery and I never regretted it.
translation.ko: 저의 대범함이 자랑스러워요 단 한 번도 후회한 적 없죠

translation.en: For 40 years, I worked almost every day.
And then one day, I got a call.
Somebody was hosting a gala dinner.
I don't like to close my restaurant for anything.
But I took the day off for the party.
All of a sudden, my daughter said,
"Mom, they called your name."
I won the award.
The Michelin star.
Right then, it seemed like I couldn't breathe.
I was happy. The happiest.
The next day,
there was a big crowd in front of my restaurant.
Everyone wanted to take my picture.
translation.ko: 다들 저를 사진에 담아 가려고 했죠

translation.en: People had to start reserving tables.
My daughter quit her job to help me manage it all.
translation.ko: 딸은 직장을 그만두고 식당 운영을 도왔죠

translation.en: When chefs started coming to my shop to eat, they called me "Chef."
Wow... I am a chef.
I can't describe how proud I was.
Put the bigger chunks in here, don't torture the customers.
translation.ko: 손님들 감질나게 하지 말고 살점 큰 거로 넣어

translation.en: I've been cooking for a long time.
Whenever anyone asks, I say I'm not tired.
translation.ko: 누가 물으면 늘 피곤하지 않다고 말해요

translation.en: I know my strength.
I have faith in charcoal fires and iron woks.
They taught me to be clever.
They taught me to be brave.
So if I still have the strength, I will continue cooking.
translation.ko: 그러니 힘이 닿는 한 요리할 거예요

translation.en: This is me.
